CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper June 13, 1970, pg. 16, reads: "Displaying Paintings - Deana Darr, an A. C. S. technician at Shadyside Hospital, displays five of her acrylic paintings of black art. Miss Darr is a student at the Art Institute of Pittsburgh, studying Fashion Illustration. She has done many portraits in charcoal, all of which were sold."
TitMainTitle: Art Institute of Pittsburgh student Deana Darr standing next to four-tiered rack displaying her acrylic paintings
